intro: Matelea pringlei, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a strong, sweet fragrance. The plant is a climbing vine with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as bats and moths. Matelea pringlei is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
